intro: Haplanthodes neilgherryensis var. neilgherryensis, commonly known as the Nilgiri thornapple, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It is characterized by its woody shrub structure and produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has spiny leaves and is adapted to the humid, tropical climate of its native habitat. It is often found in dense undergrowth in mountainous regions, where it thrives in partial shade. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
